Barley soup

Barley – 1/2 cup, washed and drained
Onion – 1 small, chopped
Mixed Vegetables – 2 cups
Green Chilies – to taste, slit
Broth/Stock/water – 4 cups
Salt – to taste
Black Pepper – to taste
Cilantro (Coriander) – for garnishing, finely chopped
Lime Juice – to taste for garnishing

1. Place washed Barley, Onions, Mixed Vegetables, Green Chilies, Broth and Salt in a pressure cooker.
2. Cover and pressure cook for 1 whistle and switch off stove.
3. Once pressure is gone from the cooker, open lid and add Cilantro, Black Pepper and Lime Juice to taste.
4. Serve hot.
Majiga Charu

•1 cup - Plain yogurt/Curd
• 1/2 cup - Water
•2 – Medium size onions (finely chopped)
•1/4 tsp - Turmeric
•1/2 tsp - Jeera/Cumin seeds
•1/2 tsp - Mustard seeds
•4 – Dried red chilies
•4 – Green chilies (finely chopped)
•2 sprigs - Curry leaves
•Coriander leaves – a small bunch (finely chopped)
•Salt to taste
•2 tsps - Oil

•1. Beat the curds and water together softly without lumps or blend it in a mixer for about 30 seconds.
•2. Add turmeric, chopped onions, green chilies to the beaten curds and mix well.
•3. Heat oil in a pan, add jeera, mustard seeds, dried red chillies, curry leaves and fry for about a minute on low flame then switch off.
•4. Add this tadka to the beaten curds, mix and garnish with chopped coriander leaves.
•5. Serve with rice and sun dried chilies (majjiga mirapakayalu/challa mirapakayalu).
Chicken Corn Soup

Chicken stock – 4 large cup
Corn cobs – 2
Butter – 1tsp
Flour – 1tbsp
Milk – 1cup
Pepper to taste
Salt to taste

1. Melt butter, add flour, stir till it becomes like breadcrumbs.
2. Remove from fire, add chicken stock and blend well.
3. When all the stock is added, add milk and return to fire.
4. Add seasoning; add corn and bring to a boil.
5. Cook till corn is tender.
Easy Tom Yum Soup

Lemongrass – 2 stalks
Kaffir lime leaves – 4
Ginger – 1 inc
Fish sauce – 3 tbsp
Lime juice – 1 tbsp
Red chili – 1/2 tsp [dired crushed chili]
Shrimp – 16
Mushrooms – 1tbsp
Cherry – 1 tbspAdd
Tomatoes – 1 tbsp
Brocoli – 1 tbsp
Coconut milk – 1/2 can
Coriander leaves – 1/2 cup
Sugar – 1 tsp
Salt to taste
Chicken stock – 6 cups

1. Measure 6 cups good-tasting chicken stock into a soup pot.
1. Use 1-2 stalks fresh lemongrass for this recipe.
2. Add 3-4 whole kaffir lime leaves to the soup pot.
3. Reduce heat to medium, or hot enough for soup to simmer.
4. Add 3-4 cloves garlic, pressed or finely chopped/minced.
5. Add 3 Tbsp. fish sauce, 1 Tbsp. fresh-squeezed lime juice, and 1 tsp.
6. Add 1/2 tsp. white sugar.
7. Add Fish sauce.
8. Add dired crushed Red chilli.
9. Add -5 sliced shiitake mushrooms, plus 1 + 1/2 cups cherry tomatoes, and about 2 cups chopped bok choy.
10. Add 12-16 medium-size shrimp (here I’m using frozen organic shrimp.
11. Reduce heat to low. Add 1/2 can coconut milk OR 1/3 to 1/2 can evaporated milk.
12. Taste-test the soup. If too sour for your taste, add a little sugar.
Thai Chicken Stock

1. Place the chicken carcass into a large pot and cover with water.
2. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer for 5 minutes.
3. Drain, and rinse the carcass under running water.
4. Return the carcass to the pot along with the galangal, lime leaves, lemon grass, chile peppers, garlic, and shallot. Pour in 10 cups of water.
5. Return to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low.
6. Simmer uncovered for 1 1/2 hours, skimming the foam and fat often.
7. Strain through cheesecloth before using.
Chicken Chawal Palak Soup

Basmati Rice – 150 gms
Chicken fillets – 250 gms
Chicken stock – 2liters
Spinach leaves – 350 gms
Lemon juice – ` tbsp
Black pepper powder – 1/2 tsp
Green chillies to taste
Salt to taste

1. Place the rice in a sieve and rinse under cold running water until the water runs clear.
2. Place the rice in a large saucepan with the chicken stock and bring to the boil. Simmer for about 10 minutes.
3. Add the sliced chicken to the pan and simmer, partly covered, for a further 5 minutes.
4. Stir in the spinach and continue simmering for another 5 minutes or until the rice is tender and the chicken and spinach are cooked.
5. Season with the lemon juice and pepper, then serve hot.
Potato Soup

Medium-sized potatoes - 2
Onion paste - 2 Tea Spoon
Turnip - 1
Tomato - 1
Water - 2 glasses
Garlic paste - 1/4 Tea Spoon
Ginger paste - 1/2 Tea Spoon
Butter - 4 Tea Spoon
Cumin seeds - 1 Tea Spoon
Coriander leaves (chopped) - 2 Tea Spoon
Salt and pepper - to taste
Sugar - 1 Tea Spoon

1. Take a deep bottomed vessel and boil potato, turnip and tomato till they are tender.
2. Blend and pass through a sieve.
3. Melt butter; add cumin seeds, onion and ginger and garlic paste. Fry till it is golden in colour.
4. Add soup, coriander leaves, salt, pepper and sugar and boil well
Kandi Kattu

Too r dal - 1 cup
Bengal gram - 1 tbs
Jeera - 1 tbs
Red chillies - 6
Mustard Seed - 1 tsp
Urad dal - 1 tsp
Curry leaves - 1 spring
Coriander leaves - 1 spring
Salt - as needed
Tamarind water - (very diluted)

1. Dry roast Toor dal, Bengal gram, Red chili, Cumin seed and soak them in water for an hour.
2. Grind them in to fine paste.
3. Take a Kadai and heat oil in it and then pour the ground paste in to it
4. Season with mustard seed, black gram and curry leaves.
5. Add tamarind water and stir well.
6. Remove from flame after 5 minutes.
7. Garnish with the coriander leaves .
8. Serve with rice or chapatti
Pineapple Rasam

Tomatoes - 2
Toor dal - ½ cup
Pine apple pieces - 1 cup
Rasam powder - 1 ½ Tea Spoon
Salt - to taste
Hing - a pinch
Turmeric - a pinch
FOR SEASONING / THADKA:
Mustard seeds - ½ Tea Spoon
Cumin seeds - ½ Tea Spoon
Oil - 1 Tea Spoon

1. Take a couple of tomatoes and chop them in to pieces and blend them as puree.
2. Pour this into a sauce pan and start the heating process
3. Add 1 1/2 tsp of rasam powder, hing, salt to taste and a pinch of turmeric.
4. Mix well and boil for about 5-8 minutes or until the raw smell of tomatoes go away.
5. Before you start the rasam process, cook Toor dal – about 1/2 cup in a pressure cooker and keep aside
6. Add some water and keep boiling the rasam.
7. Mash up the Toor dal in the blender and then add that in here.
8. Let this cook for about 5-7 minutes again.
9. If the rasam gets too thick, add water a little at a time
10. Meanwhile, chop up about 1 cup of pineapple pieces and blend to a smooth juice
11. Also, save a few pieces separately to add to the rasam later
12. Now when the dal has cooked nicely, add the pineapple juice in there and let it cook again for a few minutes. You can cook until the whole thing thickens.
13. As it boils, you can see the froth coming up
14. At that point, add about 1 tbsp of pineapple pieces. (Don’t add too much of the fruit).
15. Now, add enough water so that the rasam reaches the brim on top
16. In a small thadka pan, add a tsp of ghee and when hot, add mustard seeds to splutter. And then add fresh curry leaves and one red chilli. Add on top the rasam.
17. Now the tasty pineapple rasam is ready to serve.
Garlic Tomato soup

Tomatoes - 6 (medium sized)
Garlic - 2 cloves
Gelatin powder - 10 gm
2 Bay leaves
crushed Pepper Corn - 1½ Tea Spoon
Mixed herbs - 1½ Tea Spoon 
Salt - to taste
Skimmed Milk Yogurt - 2 Tea Spoons
Lemon juice - 2 Tea Spoon
fresh Mint - 4 sprigs

1. Wash and finely chop the tomatoes.
2. peel garlic and crush. Soak the gelatin quarter cup cold water and keep.
3. Cook the tomatoes in a saucepan along with the crushed garlic, bay leaves and cook the tomatoes in a saucepan along with the crushed game, bay leaves and crushed pepper corn for about five to six minutes or until soft.
4. Remove from the heat, cover and leave to infuse for twenty minutes.
5. Remove the bay leaves, puree the mixture and pass through a sieve.
6. Stir in the mixed herbs, salt and wine. Whisk the skimmed milk yogurt and mix into the tomato mixture.
7. Heat the gelatin lightly on a double boiler to dissolve and add to the tomato mixture. mix in the lemon juice and stir well.
8. Pour this into small ceramic pots for individual serving. refrigerate for threat to four hours to set. do not freeze.
9. Serve chilled in the same pot garnished with sprigs of fresh mint.
Broccoli Soup

Broccoli - 500 Grams
Onion - 1 medium sized
Garlic - 4 cloves
Celery Stalk - 2 inches
water - 4 cups
Low fat milk - 1 Cup
Salt - to taste
White pepper powder- to taste
Almonds - 5-6

1. Cut broccoli into small florets and wash well.
2. Soak in salted water for ten to fifteen minutes and drain.
3. Peel and roughly chop onion and garlic.
4. Wash and chop celery stalk.
5. Dry roast almonds on medium heat till almond skin changes its color slightly. Remove from heat, cool it and slice them into slivers.
6. Heat vegetable stock or water with chopped onion, garlic and celery. Bring to a boil.
7. Add broccoli florets and continue to cook without covering the pan. cook for five to seven minutes or till broccoli is tender.
8. Remove from fire, cool and puree it in a blender.
9. Add milk to pureed broccoli. Mix well. Bring to a boil again..
10. Add salt and white pepper powder to taste.
11. Stir in toasted almond slivers and serve hot.
Basil And Badam Soup

Almonds - 50 Grams (blanched and minced)
Basil (tulsi) leaves - 10 (chopped)
Water - 2 cups
Cinnamon - 1 stick
Cloves - 2-3
Salt and pepper - to taste
Green cardamoms - 2-3
Corn flour - 1 Tea Spoon

1. Boil minced almonds, water, cinnamon, cloves and green cardamom for 10 minutes.
2. Sieve and add salt, pepper and basil leaves to the liquid.
3. Boil for 5 minutes.
4. Note : If you want the soup to be more thick, add 1 tsp of corn flour mixed in 1/4 cup of water
Tomato And Coconut Soup

1/2 tsp mustard seeds
2 tsp sugar
1 pinch asafetida (Inguva)
2 tblsp oil
1 1/2 cup tomato puree
2 green chillies
2 cup warm water
4 -5 curry leaves
1/4 coconut medium
salt to taste

1.Cut the coconut into small pieces.
2.Wash, take off the stem and de-seed the green chillies.
3.Heat up the oil over a medium heat up and mix in the mustard seeds.
4.As soon as they crackle, mix in curry leaves and asafetida and fry for 15 seconds.
5.Mix in the tomato puree, coconut pieces, green chillies and water and bring to a slow simmer, stirring occasionally.
6.Take off from heat up and allow to cool slightly.
7.Mix in the soup in a blender until smooth.
8.Pour out into a pot and mix in salt and sugar and simmer (boil slowly at low temperature) for 5 minutes
9.Take off from heat up and serve hot.
Almond Chicken Soup

1. Put the almonds in a saucepan.
2. Add about one and a quarter cups of the hot stock whisking all the time until the mixture is smooth.
3. Whisk in the remaining stock and salt and white pepper.
4. Bring to the boil over a high heat, reduce the heat until the soup is bubbling gently around the edges; cook for 10 minutes.
5. Add the chicken and rice; cook for an additional 20 minutes.
6. Stir in the cream and heat through.
7. Taste and re-season if necessary.
8. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve.
Vegetable Soup

Mixed vegetables - 200 grams (beans, carrots and potatoes) finely chopped.
onion (medium sized) - 1 (chopped)
butter - 2 tablespoons
plain flour (Maida) - 1 tablespoon
milk - 4 teacups
water - 1 teacup
salt and pepper - to taste

1. Boil the vegetables in water on medium heat for about 6 minutes or till tender and cooked.\n2. In a pan, heat butter on medium level for a few seconds. Add the chopped onions and fry for about 3 minutes or till onions are transparent.\n3. Add the flour and milk. Stir well. Now add the vegetables and water. Mix well and keep on medium heat for about 4 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Thai Soup

Cauliflower Flowerets – 10
Mishroo – 6
Green chilli – 2
Lemon grass – 1piece
Narathai ilai – 2
Lime juice – 3 tsp
Coriander leaves -2 tbsp
Oil – 1 tsp
Salt to taste

1. Cut cauliflower flowerets, mushrooms, green chilli, coriander stems, finely.
2. Boil 4 cups of water in a pan.
3. Add cauliflower flowerets, mushrooms, green chilli, coriander stems, lemon grass, narathai ilai, salt and boil for 5 minutes.
4. Add lime juice, oil and switch off the stove.
Prawn Soup

1.Melt the butter or margarine and add the onion, pepper, celery and garlic. Cook gently to soften.
2.Stir in the mustard, paprika and flour. Cook about 3 minutes over gentle heat, stirring occasionally.
3.Pour on the stock gradually, stirring until well blended. Add the thyme and bay leaf and bring to the boil.
4.Reduce the heat and simmer about 5 minutes or until thickened, stirring occasionally.
Creamed Spinach and King Crab Soup

King crab meat-12oz
Spinach{chopped}-1pkg
Chicken broth-2cups
Flour-2tsp
Pepper-1/8tsp
Nutmeg-1/8tsp
Onion{chopped}-1/2cup
Butter-3tsp

1.Slice crab and reserve liquid.
2.Cook spinach according to package directions; drain. Melt butter in large saucepan.
3.Add onion and sauté until tender. Blend in flour and spices.
4.Gradually add chicken broth, stirring constantly.
5.Heat to boiling.
6.Purée spinach mixture in blender or food processor. Add half-and-half, crab liquid, and crab.
7.Heat thoroughly but do not boil. Makes 6 servings.
8.This crab soup also can be served chilled.
